This year marks the 19th anniversary of the horrific terrorist attack against all Americans on September 11, 2001. Nineteen years ago, today, on an ordinary Tuesday morning, nearly 3,000 people lost their lives in New York City, Washington, D.C., and outside Shanksville, Pa. in the worst act of terrorism against the United States in history. It was an event that forever changed the life of this country. And it was a tragedy that will be forever remembered in the consciousness of our nation.

Every year on this day, we pause to remember the victims, to grieve with the families and friends of those who died and to honor the heroes of that day, and each day since, who have sacrificed to save lives and serve their country.

The Phillipsburg School District continues to keep the families of the victims in our thoughts. While 19 years have passed, the pain remains and their memories live on.

PHS Senior Kayla Kowalaki Shines!

On March 4, PHS Senior Kayla Kowalski was invited to sing in A Class Act NY's "Miscast Cabaret". Kayla auditioned for this production early in February, and was one of the lucky performers chosen. This cabaret was directed by broadway star Lauren "Coco" Cohn, who is best known for her role as Rosie in Mamma Mia on broadway.

“A Class Act” is an award winning acting studio based in NY, providing a variety of education from the working professionals currently in the industry. They host off broadway main stage shows, cabarets, intensives, and one-day workshops. These are just a few of the many things they provide, but they offer quite an extensive list of expertise. The cabaret took place at the Triad theatre, an off broadway theater located in New York's upper west side.

Kayla will be attending the American Musical and Dramatic Arts Academy in NYC this fall to further her Musical Theater education and in hopes of pursuing her theater career.

Kayla - keep shining and please know that PSD is super proud of you!!

https://youtu.be/_oImEzhoyMw

ECLC was chosen as a beneficiary community since the organization plans on moving its headquarters into Phillipsburg in 2020.

Thank you to all that made this day magical for our students!

What a day on Warren Street at PES!

Part 1: Yesterday, all PES students participated in a “meet the author” event via Skype in conclusion of our #OneStatelinerStory initiative.

Almost 700 students filled the gym to hear Avi talk about being a writer. He told the students about descriptive writing, perseverance, creativity, and spellcheck. He also told them we were his largest audience ever!

Students had the opportunity to ask questions and share alliterations they created.

The students displayed patience and poise and made us all so proud. An audience raffle was held following the session and several lucky students went home with mouse ears and noses, and one student won the whole set of the POPPY series books.

Mrs. Kirby Hendershot and Miss Michelle Swick named W!se’s 2018-2019 Gold Star Teachers!

I’m proud to announce that two PHS Teachers, Mrs. Kirby Hendershot and Miss Michelle Swick, were named the recipients of the W!se’s 2018-2019 Gold Star Teacher Award!

W!SE (Working In Support of Education) is an educational nonprofit dedicated to building financial literacy, fostering business and social entrepreneurship, and preparing students for college and the global workplace.

To be considered for the Gold Star Award, a teacher must have at least one class achieve a 93% passing rate on either the Fall 2018 or Spring 2019 W!se Financial Literacy Certification Test.

Gold Star Teachers will be honored at the annual MoneyPOWER Conference for Financial Education, to be held in New York City, on Tuesday, November 5th.

Congratulations to Mrs. Hendershot & Miss Swick, on this outstanding and well-deserved recognition.

PHS Sign Language Club!

The PHS Sign Language Club is a club for any student interested in learning about American Sign Language and Deaf culture. Club members meet weekly to learn signs and promote an awareness of signing and culture within PHS and the surrounding community.

In honor of Deaf Awareness Week, September 23-29th, the PHS Sign Club hosted an event at the Warren County Southwest library. A short presentation of commonly used signs was followed by stations to learn and practice signs for animals, food, and ABC signs. The club members assisted participants with craft stations to make an ILY and stamp their name using the manual alphabet. The club advisor signed a story (Brown Bear, Brown Bear) and presented sign language handouts for ten popular children's books.

The club will be hosting a similar event at Easton main library on Friday, September 27th from 4:30-5:30.

Great work by the students and Sign Language Club Advisor, Allison Didden!

PHS Sophomore Wins Gold in Austria!

This past week, PHS sophomore, Josh Borelli, competed in basketball at the U16 world games for team USA through an organization called SaWUSA (Student Athlete World). This is the 15th year that SaWUSA has participated in the United World Games. SaWUSA provides opportunities for high character student-athletes and their families to travel the world and represent their country playing the sport they love. They combine the thrill of international athletic competition with the adventure and leadership benefits of international travel.

Josh played along with 8 other boys from around the United States. After 3 long days of international play, the 16U SAWUSA boys team walked away with the gold medal, finishing 6-0 by beating 2 teams from China and 2 teams from Austria and Germany.

Josh is the son of Pete and Janna Borelli. Congratulations to Josh!
